words.defineEn: someone to whom a pledge is made or someone with whom something is deposited as a pledge
words.defineVi: một người mà một cam kết được thực hiện hoặc một người nào đó được ký gửi như một cam kết

words.defineEn: a deliberately invalid argument displaying ingenuity in reasoning in the hope of deceiving someone
words.defineVi: một lập luận không hợp lệ có chủ ý thể hiện sự khéo léo trong lý luận với hy vọng lừa dối ai đó

words.defineEn: alter and make impure, as with the intention to deceive
words.defineVi: thay đổi và làm cho không trong sạch, như với ý định lừa dối

words.defineEn: the clever use of arguments that seem correct and convincing but are actually false in order to deceive people
words.defineVi: việc sử dụng khéo léo các lập luận có vẻ đúng và thuyết phục nhưng thực sự là sai để đánh lừa mọi người

examples: It could've been a vagrant who loved pancakes.
words.defineEn: someone who travels aimlessly, particularly due to having no place to call home
words.defineVi: một người đi du lịch không mục đích, đặc biệt là do không có nơi nào để gọi về nhà

examples: The vagaries of the legislative process are lost on him.
words.defineEn: an unexpected and inexplicable change in something (in a situation or a person's behavior, etc.)
words.defineVi: một sự thay đổi bất ngờ và không thể giải thích được trong một cái gì đó (trong một tình huống hoặc hành vi của một người, v.v.)

words.defineEn: a wanderer who has no established residence or visible means of support
words.defineVi: một người lang thang không có nơi cư trú cố định hoặc phương tiện hỗ trợ hữu hình

words.defineEn: high status importance owing to marked superiority
words.defineVi: tầm quan trọng địa vị cao do tính ưu việt rõ rệt

examples: One of the country's preeminent historians, Gordon-Reed teaches at Harvard Law School.
Born in 1743, Banks became the preeminent British naturalist of his day.
I know you are one of the preeminent voices when it comes to housing.
words.defineEn: greatest in importance or degree or significance or achievement
words.defineVi: lớn nhất về tầm quan trọng hoặc mức độ hoặc ý nghĩa hoặc thành tích

examples: I'm not going to exploit, for political purposes, my opponent's youth and inexperience.

And that, I do think, speaks to their inexperience and their ideological zeal, that they are so quick to want to get out of the gate with some big kind of banner policy that, you know, there are kind of obvious policy questions that a more seasoned administrator would think to ask and think to iron out beforehand, and these guys don’t.
words.defineEn: lack of experience and the knowledge and understanding derived from experience
words.defineVi: thiếu kinh nghiệm và kiến thức và sự hiểu biết có được từ kinh nghiệm
vượt quá tính toán hoặc đo lường

examples: Later amendments made borrowers ineligible to discharge their student loans through bankruptcy unless they could demonstrate undue hardship.
Meanwhile, the elections chief in Georgia announced probes of alleged efforts to register ineligible or dead voters for two U.S. Senate run-offs.
Klay Thompson missed out on being part of the all NBA team and was ineligible to get a supermax deal.

Then we've got something called voter purging, it's when election officials do maintenance, and clean up the voter list by deleting the names of ineligible voters because they moved out of state, or they didn't vote in a certain number of elections, or they've passed away.
The president won the election on his promise to get the economy into shape by overhauling outdated or inefficient legislation.
However, this enzyme is notoriously inefficient.
Supplementing orally is inefficient.
That would be inefficient.
Paradoxically, meat is pretty much the most inefficient way of feeding humans.
words.defineEn: not able to reach maximum productivity or produce desired results with minimum waste of energy, money, or time
words.defineVi: không thể đạt được năng suất tối đa hoặc tạo ra kết quả mong muốn với sự lãng phí năng lượng, tiền bạc hoặc thời gian tối thiểu

words.defineEn: the upper part of a woman's dress covering the back and chest down to the waist
words.defineVi: phần trên của chiếc váy phụ nữ che lưng và ngực xuống đến thắt lưng

examples: Loneliness is a bodily function, like hunger.
Staying awake can cause serious bodily harm.
Without the kidneys, our bodily fluids would spiral out of control.
And our bodily fluids can be pretty thick!
You can't control your bodily functions?
words.defineEn: of or relating to or belonging to the body
words.defineVi: của, liên quan đến hoặc thuộc về cơ thể

examples: And systemic racism is part of that.
One of the reasons is systemic illegal immigration.
They also cite systemic deficiencies in oversight.
You're fighting systemic racism, systemic implicit bias, all of those things at the same time.
Sam, you mentioned the need for systemic overhaul.
words.defineVi: ảnh hưởng đến cả một hệ thống

examples: For example, a 2017 systematic review examined 43 studies on the topic between 2003 and 2013.
And after that it, becomes very systematic.
And you probably know that systematic method as the scientific method.
Systematic knowledge production in abstract natural philosophy was never unified.
Their systematic approach to abstract principles was in stark contrast to the popular belief that math was an intuitive science, and an over-dependence on logic constrained creativity.
words.defineEn: done according to a system and in a planned way
words.defineVi: được thực hiện theo một hệ thống và theo một cách có kế hoạch
